transportAdvice: The Grand Canyon is primarily accessed by private vehicle or organized tour bus, as public transit options are very limited in this remote national park setting. Within the South Rim, a free shuttle bus system operates seasonally and covers major viewpoints, making it practical to get around without a car once inside the park.

weather.description: Cold and quiet winter month with possible snow on the rim and crisp, clear views.
Still cold with occasional snow, but days can be bright and uncrowded.
Temperatures begin to rise with occasional spring storms and variable conditions.
Pleasant spring weather with mild temperatures and increasing visitor numbers.
Warm and dry with excellent visibility, one of the best months to visit.
Hot and dry on the rim, extremely hot in the inner canyon — early morning hikes are essential.
Monsoon season brings afternoon thunderstorms and flash flood risk in the canyon.
Continued monsoon activity with dramatic storm skies and high humidity by canyon standards.
Monsoon winds down, temperatures ease, and crowds begin to thin — a solid shoulder month.
Cooler and comfortable with autumn light and fewer visitors than summer.
Cold nights return and snow is possible, but daytime conditions can still be pleasant.
Winter sets in with cold temperatures, possible snow, and a peaceful, uncrowded atmosphere.
